sen.j: 皇民化教育（こうみんかきょういく）は大日本帝国の支配地域において、その主権者とされた天皇を中心として大日本帝国への忠誠を要求した教化政策とされる。
sen.e: Japanization education is said to be an edification policy in territories under control of the Empire of Japan, requesting fealty toward the Empire of Japan with a focus on the Emperor, who was the ruler.
Japanization education is defined as an edification policy in territories under the governance of the Empire of Japan, requesting fealty toward the Empire of Japan led by its ruler, the Emperor.
sen.cmt: said to beをdefined asにしました。Under control ofをunder the governance ofにしました。With a focus onをled byにしました。
sen.e: Japanization education is defined as an edification policy in territories under the governance of the Empire of Japan, requesting fealty toward the Empire of Japan led by its ruler, the Emperor.

sen.j: 日本民族への教化政策であると同時に、版図内の諸民族（朝鮮人、台湾人、南洋群島島民など外地の住民や大東亜戦争時の占領地である東南アジアの先住諸民族、また稀にアイヌや琉球人など内地に住むものもこの範疇にいれる場合がある）に対して行われた強制的な同化政策・教化政策とも言われている。
sen.e: It is said to be an edification policy for the Japanese race, at the same time, a mandatory assimilationism and edification policy for peoples within the territories. (residents in foreign parts such as Koreans, Taiwanese, and Southern island residents as well as aboriginal people in South East Asia who lived in territories during the Greater East Asian War, and in rare cases, the Ainu tribe and Ryukyu (currently known as Okinawa), who lived within Japan.

It is said to be an edification policy for the Japanese race as well as a mandatory assimilationism and edification policy for peoples within the territories as shown in the figure (residents in foreign parts such as Koreans, Taiwanese, and the South Sea Islands residents as well as aboriginal people in South East Asia who lived in territories during the Greater East Asian War, and in rare cases, the Ainu tribe and Ryukyu [currently known as Okinawa], who lived within Japan).
sen.cmt: 「版図内」チェック時点でこの表現はウェブから消えていましたが、翻訳時点では何かの図があったのではないかと思われましたので、「as shown in the figure」を入れました。at the same timeをas well asにしました。residents括弧の前のピリオドを取り、文末Japanの後に閉じ括弧を入れ、一文にしました。括弧内括弧を、[ ]にしました。「南洋群島」→「the South Sea Islands」としました。
sen.e: It is said to be an edification policy for the Japanese race as well as a mandatory assimilationism and edification policy for peoples within the territories as shown in the figure (residents in foreign parts such as Koreans, Taiwanese, and the South Sea Islands residents as well as aboriginal people in South East Asia who lived in territories during the Greater East Asian War, and in rare cases, the Ainu tribe and Ryukyu [currently known as Okinawa], who lived within Japan).

sen.j: 皇民化政策とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called Japanization policy.
It is also called Japanization policy.
It is also called Japanization policy.

tit.j: 具体的内容とされるもの

sen.j: 言語統制、日本語標準語の公用語化、教育現場における方言や、各民族語などの禁止。
sen.e: Language control, making standard Japanese as the national language, banning use of dialects and languages by various ethnic groups.
Language control, making standard Japanese as the official language, prohibition against the use of dialects and ethnic languages.
Language control, making standard Japanese as the official language, prohibition against the use of dialects and ethnic languages.

sen.j: 家庭内においても標準語を使用することが奨励された。
sen.e: Standard dialect was recommended to be used also at home.
Standard language was recommended to be used also at home.
Standard language was recommended to be used also at home.

sen.j: 教育ニ関スル勅語の「奉読」、奉安殿の設置などによる学校教育での天皇崇拝の強要、日の丸掲揚や君が代斉唱などを通じ日本人意識を植え付けた。
sen.e: Japanese conscious was indoctrinated such as worshipping the Emperor by "reading" ordinance on Education and setting hoanden (premises where an imperial portrait and the Imperial Rescript on Education are housed before and during the war) as well as hoisting Hinomaru (national flag of Japan) and singing Kimigayo (Japan's national anthem).

Japanese consciousness was indoctrinated such as worshipping the Emperor by 'reverentially reading' ordinance on Education and setting hoanden (premises where an imperial portrait and the Imperial Rescript on Education are housed before and during the war) as well as hoisting Hinomaru (national flag of Japan) and singing Kimigayo (Japan's national anthem).
sen.cmt: conscious→consciousnessにしました。ダブルクオーテーションをクオーテーションにしました。あえてクオーテーションで囲ってあるので「奉読」を「reverentially reading」としました。Ordinanceが全角でした。半角に直しました。
sen.e: Japanese consciousness was indoctrinated such as worshipping the Emperor by 'reverentially reading' ordinance on Education and setting hoanden (premises where an imperial portrait and the Imperial Rescript on Education are housed before and during the war) as well as hoisting Hinomaru (national flag of Japan) and singing Kimigayo (Japan's national anthem).

sen.j: 台湾神社、朝鮮神宮等の建立や参拝の強制など、国家神道と宗教政策（日本の宗教参照）の推進。
sen.e: Promote State Shinto and religions policies (refer to Japan's religion) such as the enforced establishment of Taiwan-jinja Shrine and Chosen-jingu Shrine.
Promotion of the State Shinto and religions policies (refer to Japan's religion) such as the enforced establishment of Taiwan-jinja Shrine and Chosen-jingu Shrine.
Promotion of the State Shinto and religions policies (refer to Japan's religion) such as the enforced establishment of Taiwan-jinja Shrine and Chosen-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: その他、軍人への敬礼や皇居への遥拝なども行わせたとされる。
sen.e: In addition, saluting military men and worshipping the Emperor were part of the policy.
In addition, saluting military men and worshipping the Emperor were part of the policy.
In addition, saluting military men and worshipping the Emperor were part of the policy.

sen.j: 批判（否定）派
sen.e: Critical (negative) group
Opposition group
sen.cmt: critical groupはあまり聞かないのでOpposition groupにしました。
sen.e: Opposition group

sen.j: 徴兵や植民地支配強化を目的とした政策である。
sen.e: It was a policy with a purpose of conscription and enforcement of controlling colonies.
It was a policy with a purpose of conscription and reinforcement of colonial occupation.
sen.cmt: 「controlling colonies」→「colonial occupation」としました。「強化」→「reinforcement」としました。
sen.e: It was a policy with a purpose of conscription and reinforcement of colonial occupation.

sen.j: 皇民化教育は特に外地や占領地域においてそれぞれの民族の伝統や文化を無視し、ときには破壊した。
sen.e: Edification education especially neglected tradition and culture in foreign parts and in regions under occupation, destroying them at times.
Japanization education neglected and sometimes destroyed the tradition and culture in foreign parts and occupied areas in particular.
sen.cmt: 「皇民化教育」は「Japanization education」が用いられていますので、そろえました。「占領地域」→「occupied areas」にしました。｢特に」は「外地･･･｣にかかると思われますので、especiallyを「in particular」にして「in foreign parts｣の後に移動しました。「destroying･･･」を「and sometimes destroyed」にしてneglectedの直後にしました。
sen.e: Japanization education neglected and sometimes destroyed the tradition and culture in foreign parts and occupied areas in particular.

sen.j: 民族浄化政策として自覚的に行われたと疑う論調もある。
sen.e: There is a tone that doubt the policy to be undertaken subjectively as an ethics catharsis policy.
There is a tone that doubt the policy to be undertaken subjectively as an ethics catharsis policy.
There is a tone that doubt the policy to be undertaken subjectively as an ethnic cleansing policy.
sen.cmt: チェッカーのコメントどおりethics catharsis→ethnic cleansingに変更しました。

sen.j: この時代の教育の影響で、民族語を持てず、民族的文化的アイデンティティーが危うくなるなどの後遺症に苦しむ人もいる。
sen.e: As an influence from the education from this period, there are people who suffer from the aftermath, such as not being able to have an ethic language and ethical and cultural identities been jeopardized.

Influenced by the education of this period, some people have suffered from the aftermath, such as not being able to have their ethnic language and their ethnic and cultural identities being jeopardized.
sen.cmt: As an influence from→Influenced byとしました。From this period→of the periodsufferを現在完了形にしました。Ethical、ethic→ethnicにしました。ethical以下の主語動詞が曖昧でしたので、theirをつけ、beenをbeingとしました。
sen.e: Influenced by the education of this period, some people have suffered from the aftermath, such as not being able to have their ethnic language and their ethnic and cultural identities being jeopardized.

sen.j: 「日本人と対等に扱う政策であった」との擁護論があるが、日本人化するという発想自体が日本人を優位と見るものであり、差別の証拠である。
sen.e: There is a theory that advocates it as a "policy treating them equally with the Japanese" but the concept itself, Japanizing them, places Japanese superior which is an evidence of discrimination.

There is a theory that advocates it as a 'policy treating them equally with the Japanese' but the concept of Japanization itself considers Japanese being superior, presenting an evidence of discrimination.
sen.cmt: Is "equally with"(not "equal to" or "equally to") gramatically correct? ダブルクオーテーションをクオーテーションにしました。「Concept itself, Japanizing them」を「concept of Japanization itself」にしました。「places」を「considers」にしました。Superiorの前にbeingを入れました。Whichがこの場所にありますと先行詞が不明です。Presentingにしました。
sen.e: There is a theory that advocates it as a 'policy treating them equally to the Japanese' but the concept of Japanization itself considers Japanese being superior, presenting an evidence of discrimination.
sen.cmt: チェッカーのコメントどおりequally with→equally toに変更しました。

sen.j: 肯定派
sen.e: Affirmative group
Affirmative group
Affirmative group

sen.j: 国家に役立つ人材を輩出するために行われた。
sen.e: It was done in order to produce people useful to the nation.
It was done in order to produce people useful to the nation.
It was done in order to produce people useful to the nation.

sen.j: 現在の価値観からは非難されるが、当時としては同化政策によって国民統合を図るのは普通のことであった。
sen.e: It is criticized from the present sense of value but at the time, it was common to plan national integration by assimilation policy.
It deserves criticizm by current standards, but at the time, it was common to achieve national integration by assimilationism.
sen.cmt: 「assimilation policy」→「assimilationism」、「plan」→「achieve」としました。For "It is criticized from the present sense of value", I replaced "It deserves criticizm by current standards".
sen.e: It deserves criticizm by current standards, but at the time, it was common to achieve national integration by assimilationism.

sen.j: 当時の西洋列強が行っていた、植民地支配と現地住民に対する扱いとは違い、皇民化政策は思想と言語統一によって他民族を日本人化することで、日本人と植民地住民を対等に扱おうとするものであった。
sen.e: Edification policy was to Japanize other ethic groups by integrating thoughts and the language, treating Japanese and the residents in colonies equally, which is different from how the Western powers controlled colonies and treated local residents.

Different from the way of Western powers' governing colonies and treating their local residents, the Japanization policy was to Japanize other ethnic groups by integrating thoughts and the language, and treating Japanese and the residents in colonies equally.
sen.cmt: 「皇民化」は「Japanization」にそろえました。Ethic→ethnicにしました。Treating Japaneseと前の文の関係がよく分かりません。一応andでつなぎました。Whichの先行詞が、ここですとcoloniesと解釈されかねないと思いましたので、which isを削除し、different以下を文頭に移動し、howをthe wayにしました。
sen.e: Different from the way of Western powers' governing colonies and treating their local residents, the Japanization policy was to Japanize other ethnic groups by integrating thoughts and the language, and treating Japanese and the residents in colonies equally.

sen.j: 現に一視同仁をスローガンにしていた。
sen.e: In fact, the impartiality was their slogan.

sen.j: これは、当時の日本が構想した大東亜共栄圏に繋がる思想である。
sen.e: This is a thought leading to the Great East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere which was Japan's concept at the time.
This is a thought leading to the Great East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere which was Japan's concept at the time.
This is a thought leading to the Great East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere which was Japan's concept at the time.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦終了後日本を占領した連合国軍最高司令官総司令部は、国家のための自己犠牲を奨励していた皇民化教育が軍国主義国家形成に果たした役割が大きかったと考え、教育改革に乗り出した。
sen.e: The General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ), who occupied Japan after the Second World War, worked on education reform, thinking that edification education, which promoted sacrificing oneself for the nation, played a big role in forming the militarism nation.

The General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) which occupied Japan after the Second World War worked on education reform, thinking that Japanization education, which promoted sacrificing oneself for the nation, played a big role in forming the militarism nation.
sen.cmt: GHQはモノとして扱ってよいのではないかと思いましたので、whichにし、制限用法にしました。「皇民化教育」は「Japanization education」にそろえました。
sen.e: The General Headquarters of the Allied Powers (GHQ) which occupied Japan after the Second World War worked on education reform, thinking that Japanization education, which promoted sacrificing oneself for the nation, played a big role in forming the militarism nation.

sen.j: 教育勅語が教育現場から排除され、教育の基本法として教育基本法が制定された。
sen.e: The Imperial Rescript on Education was removed from educational scenes and the Fundamental Law of Education was set as the fundamental law for education.
The Imperial Rescript on Education was removed from educational sites and the Fundamental Law of Education was set as the fundamental law for education.
The Imperial Rescript on Education was removed from educational sites and the Fundamental Law of Education was set as the fundamental law for education.

sen.j: ただ、標準語の推進は以後も積極的に推し進めた。
sen.e: However, the use of standard dialect was proactively promoted continuously afterward.
However, the use of standard language was proactively promoted continuously afterward.
However, the use of standard language was proactively promoted continuously afterward.
